paragraph.content: pt received one dose of spironolactone on 2021-11-25 at 1700 and developed a rash, bilateral arms and chest on 2021-11-26.

tr.td: Title: CV Surgery VAD Discharge Note

Patient: PARKER, Michael Daniel MRN: - fin:u8427804923
Age: 51 Years Sex: Male DOB: 1970-12-03

Secondary Diagnosis(es)
follow up in VAD clinic in 1 month

Discharge Follow Up
No Follow Up Appointments on Record

Continue HD MWF
Follow up in VAD Clinic within 1 month or as previously scheduled

Patient is a 51 y/o M with ICM s/p BiVAICD (St. Jude; Dr. Gaitonde), Stage D/Class III HFrEF s/p HMIII (2021-10-24), CAD s/p PCI to RCA 2014, paroxysmal Afib, ESRD on HD MWF, recent RLE cellulitis and recent multiple admissions over the past few months. Was recently admitted 2022-08-14 due to receiving three ICD shocks, s/p VT ablation on 2022-08-23. Patient presented to the hospital today due to fluid overload. He was unable to attend his normal scheduled HD session due to his care giver becoming ill and they were unable to travel with him. Due to his VAD he must have someone with him during his HD treatments. He stated that there was no one else to go with him. He was admitted to for fluid volume excess

Labs on admission were drawn and stable. Nephrology was consulted and patient received HD. Labs this morning following HD were reviewed and stable. Patient is stable on RA and ready to discharge home. He will continue HD MWF and follow with regular out patient VAD clinic appointment.
VAD set speed 6000 rpms
Low speed limit 5600 rpms
If traveling, patient must have back up controller and 2 fully charged batteries
Anticoagulation:
Aspirin 325mg daily
Eliquis 2.5mg BID
Driveline exit site care:
Care using central line protocol/VAD dressing protocol
Sterile technique
Masks for all in room during dressing change
Sign on closed door during dressing change
Dressing is to be done every day
Lines: None, AVF for HD
Antibiotics: None
Home Health: VNA and Maxim home health
Home health orders: Resume previous orders
Medication Changes: Increase Hydralazine to 150mg PO TID
BP to be taken using Doppler
Doppler BP goal 60-85
Call if BP > 90 or < 60
Other: HD MWF
_____________________
Chronic HFrEF s/p insertion of HeartMate 3 left ventricular assist device, ligation of left atrial appendage 2021-10-24
ICM
ICD (St. Jude)
Stage D, NYHA Class III
- ECHO 2022-05-23:
Technically difficult study. s/p LVAD; speed 6000 RPM. Left ventricle is mildly dilated. LVEDd 5.5 cm. The LV ejection fraction is visually estimated at 15-20%. Severe global hypokinesis of the left ventricle. The left ventricular septum is midline. The left ventricular assist device inflow cannula is seen in the apex with normal flow. The right ventricle is moderately enlarged and hypokinetic. The aortic valve opens frequently. Trace aortic valve regurgitation. Trace mitral regurgitation is present.Normal IVC size and collapse c/w RAP of 0 to 5 mmHg.
- LVAD interrogated, stable parameters, no alarms
- LDH stable
- Diuretics: Bumex 3 mg po BID, HD MWF per Nephrology
- GDMT: Metoprolol XL 100 mg daily
- AC: ASA 325mg daily, Eliquis 2.5mg PO BID
- DLES dressing changes: daily using daily kit
CAD
- s/p PCI to RCA 2014
- LHC 3-2019: LM/LAD/LCX patent arteries and patent prox RCA stent
- Cont ASA/Statin and BB
VF with hx appropriate ICD discharge
- Patient had an episode of 3 shocks around 1600 on 12/12.
- St. Jude Quadra Assura MP 3369-40Q CRT-D
- now s/p VT ablation with Dr. Gaitonde 2022-08-23
- Continue home Amio, Toprol and Mexiletine
Persistent Afib
- Amio PO 200 mg bid
- AC as above
HTN
- MAP goal 70-85
- Metoprolol 100mg daily + Hydralazine 100 mg Q8H + Isosorbide dinitrate 30mg TID
- Increase Hydralazine to 150mg PO TID 2022-09-08
ESRD
- Cont HD MWF, missed HD 2022-09-07, got HD overnight with 3L UF, next HD 2022-09-10
- Continue home erythropoietin per last renal recs
- Previously renal suggested HD MWFS
Uncontrolled
DM type 2 complicated by peripheral neuropathy
- Hgb A1c 7.6 on 2021-09-04 and 5.6 on 3/30
- Continue home regimen of insulin glargine 20 units subcutaneous daily plus insulin lispro 3 units 3 times daily with meals
- Follow up outpatient for ongoing management
Anxiety/insomnia
- Can continue home duloxetine 30 mg available daily if needed
- Can continue home hydroxyzine 50 mg and melatonin 5 mg at bedtime if needed
GERD
- Home famotidine 20 mg daily
Gout
- Home allopurinol 100 mg by mouth Monday Wednesday Friday
Restless leg syndrome/tremor
- Continue home ropinirole
Hx substance abuse
- hx smoking marijuana for several years, now states quit since VAD implant
- 2022-02-03 UDS + for opiates and tricyclic antidepressant, no opiates were prescribed for pt
Physical Exam
Vitals & Measurements
T: 36.8 °C T: 97.8 °F (Oral) TMIN: 97.8 °F (Oral) TMAX: 36.8 °C HR: 84 HR: 79 (Monitored) HR: 80 (Peripheral) RR: 18 BP: 114/82 MAP: 93 SpO2: 99% WT: 113.6 kg WT: 109.1 kg BMI: 36.6
No qualifying data available.

General: Well nourished, no acute distress, up ad lib in room, appears comfortable
Neurologic: Awake, alert, and oriented X3, sensation to all extremities intact, no focal deficits
Lungs: Clear to auscultation, diminished bases, non-labored respiration, on RA
Heart: Normal rate, regular rhythm, paced on monitor, no JVD, no edema BLE, VAD hum auscultated
Abdomen: Soft, non-tender, non-distended, normal bowel sounds
Musculoskeletal: Normal range of motion and strength, no tenderness or swelling
Skin: Skin is warm, dry and normal for race, no rashes or lesions, DLES c/d/i w/o drainage or erythema
Psychiatric: Cooperative, appropriate mood and affect

home
Discharge Orders
No qualifying data available.

stable
Discharge Disposition
home
